result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Ray James Burbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin Ray James Burbach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin Ray James Burbach was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Financial obligations are not a condition of extended supervision or probation and are to be paid directly to the
Lafayette County Clerk of office.

Defendant shall serve 15 days in the Lafayette County Jail with Huber privileges. 
Defendant shall be eligible for good time calculation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Ray James Burbach

records.addlTxt:
1:05 PM 
Defendant Kevin Ray James Burbach in court.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet in court for Kevin Ray James Burbach.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Holevoet Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "GUILTY" - Count 1.
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Holevoet re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves to dismiss - Count 2.
So ordered.

State moves for joint recommendation of the paties.
Attorney Holevoet joins in the motions.
Defendant apologies to the court.

Court Orders:
-Costs
-15 Day's County Jail w/Huber and Good Time Calculation (REPORT DATE 09/24/2022) - 1 Day Credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:32 PM Defendant Kevin Ray James Burbach in court.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet in court for Kevin Ray James Burbach.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Holevoet informs Court that offer has been made and requests continuance.
Set for plea and sentence 9/20/22 at 1:00 p.m.
